alert.note: Alert for Macon; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 4:43AM CDT until July 19 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Macon, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Goose Creek including areas near Meadorville, Hillsdale, Beech Grove and Halltown, Upper Bledsoe Creek including Bethpage and Bransford, Lower Bledsoe Creek including Castalian Springs, Dixon Creek including Dixon Springs, Middle Fork Drakes Creek including areas near Fairfield and Withamtown, and Little Goose Creek including Hartsville. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gallatin, Lafayette, Hartsville, Westmoreland, Portland, Mitchellville, Bethpage, Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area, Bledsoe Creek State Park, Dixon Springs, Oak Grove and Pleasant Shade. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
